result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared D. Roiger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Offices, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant must successfully complete the two year probationary period in Taylor County Case No. 16CF25 and all required conditions of probation.
Defendant must obtain full time employment or be enrolled in school full time at discretion of agent.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Defendant must attend counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.    Defendant must pay previous bail bond forfeiture through probation. Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The unpaid costs are reduced to a civil judgment.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Court calls case No. 15CF56 and 16CF25.  Defendant Jared D. Roiger in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Jared D. Roiger in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty states recommendation on sentence.  Atty Kelz argument on jail sentence and furlough.  State objects to furlough.  Argument.  DE makes statement.  Court orders on 16CF25 on Ct. 1 - 90 days in Taylor County jail with Huber and good time.  Ct. 2 - 6 months Taylor County jail, concurrent to Ct. 1.  Court costs reduced to civil judgment.   68 days sentence credit.  15CF56 - Court imposed a withheld sentence, placed DE on probation for 2 years with conditions of: court costs; DNA sample; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; To maintain full time employment  or to be enrolled in school full time at discretion of agent. Court orders previous bail forfeiture that DE is on a payment plan on through the clerks office should be paid through probation.

Defendant Jared D. Roiger in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for revocation of deferred entry of judgment. Defendant does not object to the revocation. Court orders Count 1 revoked and finds defendant guilty  of Count 1. Sentencing Hearing scheduled for 9-27-2017 at 9:30 a.m. Atty. Kelz requests a furlough for sentencing; Court informs Atty. Kelz that he needs to address that with the Department of Corrections. ap
Sentencing hearing on September 27, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jared D. Roiger in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin by phone.   Attorney Tlusty explains the cases to the judge and requests that the warrants be quashed.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $150.00 cash bond and a $350.00 signature bond with booking and no contact with E.E.M. - dob:  3-28-87 for all of the cases.  Judge Fox quashes the warrant.  The defendant has no objection to the bonds.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is September 26, 2017 at 1:00 pm.  - rt

Defendant Jared D. Roiger not in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was sent to his parent's address and was not returned to the district attorney's office.  Defendant did not update his address with the court.  It is now 2:56 pm.  The court is ordering a body only bench warrant.  - rt

Defendant Jared D. Roiger in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty placed agreement on the record.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists. Plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty.  Pursuant to the agreement the court deferred entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of 2 years.  Court accepted the agreement and signed the same.  ba

Defendant Jared D. Roiger in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty filed an amended criminal complaint with the court.  Attorney Nocco waived the formal reading of the complaint.  Officer Mike Schroeder sworn and examined.  Court satisfied that probable cause that defendant committed a felony.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Jury trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final Pre-trial scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  - rt
